ProjectTitle: Data-centric distributed signal processing for spatial filtering in wireless sensor networks
InitialFeedbackHistory:
13/03/2024
"Research Data Summary"
You only mention your source data in the table.
In the context of a DMP, data is more than this: code, visualisations, processed data, ect. are also considered data.
Think of all the steps in your research project and include the other types of data in the table. 
For more information on this, check the RDM website of KU Leuven: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-standards
"Data Sharing and reuse"
"Will the data (or part of the data) be made available for reuse after/during the project?"
Reflect the changes in the data table in this question. Go over the different rows, and state for each if the data will be shared. 
This also applies to the other questions in this section. 
"Are there any factors that restrict or prevent the sharing of (some of) the data?"
You mention valorisation potential at the start. Does this also restrict data sharing? 
"When will the data be made available?"
By definition, keeping the data on the servers cannot be considered as using a repository.
For more information on repositories: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing
label: good with suggestions
